author: Europa Press
title: Estabilizado un incendio de cerca de 15 hectáreas de pasto en Aranjuez (Madrid)
text:
Estabilizado un incendio de cerca de 15 hectáreas de pasto en Aranjuez (Madrid)
Varias dotaciones de Bomberos y de Brigadas Forestales de la Comunidad de Madrid han intervenido...
Europa Press
Jueves, 10 de julio 2025, 17:25
Varias dotaciones de Bomberos y de Brigadas Forestales de la Comunidad de Madrid han intervenido este jueves en Aranjuez para estabilizar un incendio que se ha desarrollado en una zona de pasto de la ciudad, afectando a unas 15 hectáreas. En concreto, hasta la zona se han desplazado 18 dotaciones de Bomberos y Brigadas Forestales, de los que cuatro son medios aéreos y los 14 restantes medios terrestres. El incendio no ha dejado víctimas ni heridos, aunque sí se ha desarrollado en una zona cercana a viviendas. Los efectivos siguen aún en el lugar realizando labores de refresco de la zona y recorriendo el terreno en busca de posibles puntos calientes.(Fuente: Emergencias Madrid)

author: NewsBreak Original
title: The warmest December in Plymouth County history
text: The popular image of an idyllic December is one of white Christmases, hot chocolate retreats, snow-capped conifers, and cozy, cold-weather activities. But not every December lives up to those expectations. Most of the continental U.S. will experience its peak winter cold weather in January and February . Officially, winter doesn't even start until Dec. 21. Across the U.S., the average December temperature from 1901-2000 was right above freezing point, at 32.68 F. Yearly temperatures can be compared to this 20th-century long-term average to find how uncommon a year's December climate was. The nation's warmest December on record was 2021, when the average temperature reached 6.66 F above the long-term average, at 39.34 F. December 2022 was closer to the previous century's average for the U.S. overall, at 33.08 F. The average temperature in Plymouth County, Iowa from 1901-2000 was 20.8. The diverse climates of the U.S. mean residents can experience a range of holiday weather without breaking out their passports. Within the continental U.S., Monroe County, Florida, at the Southeast tip of the state, reported the highest average December temperature during the past century at 67.6 F. On the other end of the spectrum was Roseau County, Minnesota, bordering Canada, at 7.2 F. However, across both sides of the extremes, temperatures are warming. While that doesn't mean every December will be warmer than the last or the prior century's average, it does mean long-term temperature averages will continue to inch up the thermometer. When did Plymouth County, Iowa experience its warmest December? To find out, Stacker used data from the National Centers for Environmental Information to identify the 15 Decembers with the highest average temperature since 1895. Also included is how that year's temperature compared to the 1901-2000 average. Read on to see if you lived through the warmest December in Plymouth County, Iowa history.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Primanti Bros. offering 2-cent sandwiches this weekend
text:
By Andrew Limberg ,
2 hours ago
Pittsburgh-born Primanti Bros. has once again been named the “Coolest Thing Made in PA” after winning a bracket-style contest featuring 64 brands across the commonwealth.
To celebrate back-to-back championships, Primanti Bros. is offering 2-cent sandwiches all weekend long, April 19 – April 21 (after purchasing one at full price).
“Win once - maybe it's a fluke. Win twice - and maybe we really are the coolest thing made in Pennsylvania," said Adam Golomb, CEO, Primanti Bros. “We’re excited to offer this awesome deal to all the fans who voted us to victory.”
Primanti Bros. beat out Mrs. T’s Pierogies last year and Reese’s Cups this year.
Primanti’s says the deal will be honored at all of their locations and is available for take out or dine-in. If you’re ordering online, use the code 2CENTS at checkout.
“It’s really a great way for us to cap off what was a year-long celebration of our 90th Anniversary,” said Golomb. “We honored that our home state of Pennsylvania is still rooting for us.”
The PA Chamber will be visiting the original Primanti Bros. location in the Strip District next week to celebrate the victory.

author: Kevincm
title: Emirates expands its Vegan options onboard
text: We’re in Veganuary at the moment, so airlines are hopping on the Vegan wagon with their offerings – with Emirates showing off. The airline has noted a surge of 40% in customer demand for plant-based meals. To meet this demand in 2024, Emirates will introduce an array of new vegan dishes onboard and in lounges later this year, adding even more dishes to its ‘vegan vault’ of more than 300 curated plant-based recipes. Emirates has served up more than 450,000 plant-based meals onboard, an increase from 280,000 plant-based meals served in 2022, with the biggest increases on routes to China, Japan and the Philippines. Notably, the biggest increase in consumption of vegan meals occurred in Economy Class. In all four classes, Emirates has items to tease the tastebuds First class Items such as creamy polenta cake with thyme mushroom ragout, sautéed spinach drizzled in a rich root vegetable jus will be offered, along with aubergine curry with charred rice and turmeric potato, with a dash of coconut and mint chutney. Desserts feature curated contrasts including the tartness of rhubarb tempered with strawberry charlotte, Chantilly cream and raspberry tuille, or a tempting warm chocolate fondant, dashed with salted caramel sauce and whipped cashew cream. Business Class The airline offers a range of curated dishes are offered including roasted cauliflower with ancient grains, caramelised pear and lovage pesto or a warming ragout of Asian tofu and shitake mushroom with glass noodles, as well as vegan kebab. Desserts include tropical coconut pineapple cake or indulge in a chocolate cheesecake accented by a dark chocolate cigar and strawberry compote. Economy Class There are offerings such as chickpea crepe stuffed with carrot, peppers, mushroom and tomato concasse, experience a textured pumpkin frittata, tuck into a tofu tikka masala or enjoy a hearty chickpea kale stew with parsley pilaf rice and baby spinach. These are accompanied with vegan desserts including a coconut mousse with mango compote, moist banana cake with chocolate crumble or luscious chocolate pudding with cocoa soil. Premium Economy Options include dishes like jackfruit curry with basmati rice, or a rich squash chestnut stew followed by a light chocolate tofu cheesecake or a smooth and raspberry parfait with a pop of orange compote. More options coming soon Later in the year, Emirates will be launching a selection of new vegan main courses, new vegan snacks such as fruit muffins and vegan pizza, and an array of delectable desserts including chocolate pecan cake, pistachio raspberry and raspberry tonka cake. In total, Emirates will rotate through over 300 Vegan options Ordering Vegan options Vegan options are available to pre-order on board and order directly in First Class, as well as in Emirates Lounges. Customers can request vegan meals on all Emirates flights and across all classes of travel up to 24 hours before departure. Giving the choice to passengers We can go on a lot about passenger experience – but there are always two things people remember – how long you were stuck in the tube that took you in the sky and the food – and thus, the quality of food, as well as the options, becomes a very important differentiator between airlines. And airlines by their nature offer more choice of meals, especially those marketing to those with dietary/religious requirements. Seeing Emirates work around their menu rotations as well as dedication to vegan offerings (along with other meals), both in the air and in their lounge c0mplexes will provide both reassurance and choice to those who have a dietary requirement – vegan, or otherwise. Welcome to Economy Class and Beyond. Your no-nonsense guide to network news, honest reviews, in-depth coverage, unique research, as well as the humour and madness I only know how to deliver. Our Social Media pool has expanded. You can find us across most networks as @economybeyond on [Twitter,](http://www.twitter.com/EconomyBeyond) [Mastodon](https://mastodon.social/@economybeyond), [BlueSky,](https://bsky.app/profile/economybeyond.bsky.social) [Threads ](https://www.threads.net/@economybeyond)and Also, remember that we are part of the [BoardingArea](http://www.boardingarea.com/#_ga=2.233490334.1641858689.1688658473-2018240217.1683122316) community, bringing you the latest frequent flyer news from around the world.

author: @francagiansol
title: Papa Francesco va in Oceania per denunciare il climate change, ma il volo di 32 ore produce più emissioni di un uomo in un anno
text: Papa Francesco l'aveva annunciato in tv da Fabio Fazio e ora è ufficiale: il prossimo agosto andrà a Papua Nuova Guinea, praticamente dall'altra parte del pianeta. A 87 anni è pronto per la trasferta più lunga del pontificato: oltre 30 ore di volo, sopportando un fuso di nove ore. Il programma di una decina di giorni dovrebbe anche comprendere, secondo la Croix, Timor Est e l'Indonesia. Caldo africano anomalo, Copernicus allarmato per il settembre più caldo di tutta la storia e il Papa insiste: «Colpa dell'uomo» La Nuova Guinea è nei suoi piani da tempo. Vuole visitare questa zona del mondo perché è considerata la frontiera più evidente dei cambiamenti climatici con tante piccole isole già sommerse dall'innalzamento delle acque. Il riscaldamento sta sciogliendo i ghiacci polari. Le isole Carteret, per esempio, sono state il primo sito al mondo in cui tutti i residenti, già diversi anni fa, hanno dovuto migrare in blocco: i primi migranti climatici - secondo la definizione dell'Onu - costretti a spostarsi sotto la minaccia crescente delle acque che rischiano di inghiottire case e coltivazioni. Ad aver annunciato la trasferta papale è stato il governo della Papuasia. Nei giorni scorsi il premier James Marape ha ricevuto una nota ufficiale da parte del Vaticano in cui si confermavano i progetti elaborati in precedenza. L'ultimo pontefice ad aver messo piede da quelle parti è stato Giovanni Paolo II nel 1995. Clima, assist di Papa Francesco alla COP28 con l'esortazione green Laudate Deum, negazionisti vade retro Il Papa della Laudato Si è atteso con gioia a Port Moresby, la capitale, dove arriverà in aereo. Chissà se ha tenuto conto delle emissioni di C02 visto che l'aereo è la forma di trasporto che produce la maggior quantità di gas serra: nelle 32 ore di volo produrrà emissioni pari a quelle di un uomo in un anno intero. Riscaldamento globale, il 2023 l'anno più caldo di sempre La visita era in programma da anni ma poi annullata per via della pandemia. Lì Papa Francesco troverà il cardinale John Ribat, arcivescovo di Port Moresby 67 anni, nativo della Nuova Britannia. Nel suo villaggio natale i missionari francesi avevano fondato la prima parrocchia di Papua Nuova Guinea. E' noto per il suo impegno a favore dell'ambiente e per aver difeso le nazioni insulari del Pacifico sommerse dalle acque. Un po di tempo fa, in una intervista, ha raccontato che per lui vivere il celibato è una sfida. «Per me, il pensiero di avere una moglie, nella vita, sarà sempre lì, e una sfida che devo affrontare fino alla morte. E ne parlo con i sacerdoti, e lavoro anche con i seminaristi, ed è di questo che parlo. Come vediamo questo dono dato da Dio per noi? Come vediamo dare la vita agli altri e costruire la comunità e l'unità che vogliamo vedere?» Climate change, allarme Oms: il clima impazzito colpisce testa, cuore, vista e il sistema neurologico

author: S. COSTA D.
title: Trabajadores de la oficina de extranjería de Lleida denuncian el colapso del servicio
text:
LABORAL
Trabajadores de la oficina de extranjería de Lleida denuncian el colapso del servicio
Critican que solo hay 14 funcionarios en activo de los 32 que debería y que no se cubren jubilaciones ni vacantes
"Hemos pasado de tramitar en un mes la mayor parte de los expedientes a tardar entre 3 y 6, no podemos hacer nada, no somos suficientes"
Trabajadores de la oficina de extranjería de Lleida han hecho una protesta esta mañana para denunciar el colapso de este servicio por la falta de personal, lo que provoca importantes demoras en la tramitación de los expedientes para que personas de fuera de España puedan obtener un permiso de trabajo y regularizar su situación. La concentración ha sido convocada por los sindicatos CCOO, CGT y UGT, que destacan que llevan años avisando de esta situación que irá a más en las próximas semanas y meses, y han señalado que hasta que no se resuelva esta situación se concentrarán todos los jueves a las 10.30 horas delante de la oficina de extranjería y la comisaría de la Policía Nacional de Lleida, que está situada en la avenida de Prat de la Riba.
"Tenemos un retraso enorme en la tramitación de los expedientes", ha admitido Marina Coterillo, una trabajadora que lleva 17 años en la oficina de Lleida. "Hace seis años tardábamos aproximadamente entre un mes, mes y medio en tramitar la mayoría de los expedientes que nos llegaban y ahora hemos pasado a tardar entre 3 y 6 meses, esto provoca que la gente no pueda seguir trabajando, acceder a determinadas ayudas o a la prestación de desempleo", lamenta Coterillo. Esto se debe, aseguran la trabajadora y los sindicatos, que no se cubren las bajas ni las jubilaciones, ni de la oficina de Lleida ni de todo el Estado. En Lleida deberían haber 32 personas, pero la realidad es que ahora mismo son 14. "Recibimos llamadas de gente que está desesperada y no podemos hacer nada, no somos suficientes", lamenta Coterillo, que detalla que cada día reciben entre 50 y 80 expedientes mediante el registro electrónico, atienden una quincena de citas previas "y llamadas telefónicas de forma constante".
Los trabajadores advierten que esta situación de colapso irá a más a partir del 20 de mayo, día en que entre en vigor un real decreto que modifique las condiciones para que los extranjeros puedan obtener un permiso de trabajo. "Se van a flexibilizar bastante ciertos tipos de permisos como las regularizaciones a través del arraigo social, los plazos para presentarlos van a ser más cortos, hará falta menos tiempo de estancia irregular en España para presentar las regularizaciones y podrá presentarlo mucha más gente y en ningún momento se ha propuesto ampliar la plantilla", critica Coterillo.
Por su parte, la delegada sindical de CCOO de la Administración General del Estado en Lleida, Barbaria Primo, critica que la falta de personal en las oficinas de extranjería se debe, en parte, "a que la retribución que reciben es diferente a otros organismos equiparables como el SEPE, la Seguridad Social o Tráfico". Denuncia que "no puede ser que los expedientes no se resuelvan hasta mínino de 3 meses y deban pasar un calvario para pedir cita previa, han venido personas desespedaras porque les echarán de su puesto de trabajo por no tener renovada la Tarjeta de Identidad de Extranjero. Esto es violencia institucional y no puede ser que la discriminación a trabajadores extranjeros empiece desde la propia administración", ha lamentado Primo.
Paralelamente, Josep Vilarassau, de CGT, denunció que otro problema que tienen son las condiciones de sus oficinas, que tienen numerosas deficiencias y lo han denunciado ante inspección de trabajo. "En la primera planta tenemos una treintena de goteras", ha dicho Vilarassau, mientras que la escalera de emergencias "también está clausurada". Ha añadido que desde inspección de trabajo les dio un plazo de 6 meses a la subdelegación del Gobierno en Lleida para que solucione estas deficiencias "pero no han hecho nada, les han dado otro plazo de 6 meses que expira en junio y todavía no han empezado a hacer nada de nada".

author: ZUM 뉴스 | 매일경제
title: LG AI washing machine wins IR52 Jang Young-shil Award : ZUM 뉴스
text: LG Electronics Inc.’s artificial intelligence (AI)-backed washing machine won the 2023 IR52 Jang Young-shil Award on Thursday. The LG AI UP Home Appliance Washing Machine not only automatically adjusts washing options according to the laundry load via AI but continuously upgrades itself with new features beyond the purchase date. The IR52 Jang Young-shil Awards ceremony, organized by the Ministry of Science and ICT and hosted by the Korea Industrial Technology Association (KOITA) Maeil Business Newspaper was held on Thursday at the Maeil Media Center in Jung District, central Seoul. The event was attended by about 100 people, including Minister of Science and ICT Lee Jong-ho, KOITA Chairman Koo Ja-gyun, and Maekyung Media Group Chairman Chang Dae-whan. Founded in 1991 and celebrating its 33rd anniversary in 2024, the IR52 Jang Young-shil Award is the highest Korean technology award given to researchers who lead the development of innovative technologies developed by Korean companies. “One Presidential Award, two Prime Minister’s Awards, 17 products, and two organizations were ultimately selected by 138 members from 23 specialized committees, who helped with preliminary judging, and 17 members of the final judging committee,” Ryu Seok-hyun, president of the Korea Institute of Machinery & Materials and chair of the judging panel, said. [Courtesy of LG Electronics Inc.] The LG AI UP Home Appliance Washing Machine, which received the Presidential Award, improved washing performance compared to conventional washing machines by comprehensively adjusting washing motions, temperatures, times, rinsing, and spinning based on environmental information including the load, pollution recognition, and weather. It also uses deep learning models to predict vibrations during washing or spinning to reduce noise and vibration. The winning product has been certified for suitability and safety for deep learning performance and software upgrade technology by UL, the world’s first global safety standard development and certification organization for the consumer electronics industry. “AI washing and spinning functions evolve in directions suitable for the environment and preferences using data,” an LG Electronics researcher said. “We will research precise environment customization and user customization moving forward.” Hyundai Motor Co.’s Hydrogen Fuel Cell Large Truck won the Prime Minister’s Award, with the company the first to develop and commercialize the product for mass production globally. The winning product can be fully charged within 8 to 25 minutes with cooling charging takes less than 10 minutes, and the truck can travel over 400 kilometers when fully charged based on a charging pressure of 350 bars. The hydrogen fuel cell truck, which generates fuel cell power using hydrogen stored in high-pressure tanks and oxygen in the air, operates the motor via electric energy. Energy that is regenerated via the motor is used during deceleration to charge high-voltage batteries, improving both energy efficiency and range. “We will continuously develop autonomous driving technology to enhance safety, convenience, and marketability,” a Hyundai Motor executive said. “We will develop a dedicated platform for eco-friendly vehicles by 2030 to improve vehicle performance and efficiency on top of ensuring quality and price competitiveness.” [Courtesy of Hyundai Motor Co.] HK inno.N Corp.’s K-Cap Tablet is a therapeutic agent for gastroesophageal reflux disease and is Korea’s 30th new drug released in 2019. Existing therapeutic agents for gastroesophageal reflux disease using proton pump inhibitors had a slow onset of action and had to be taken before meals, thus causing patients inconvenience. In contrast, the K-Cap tablet takes effect rapidly within 30 minutes of administration without requiring an activation process, unlike proton pump inhibitors, and can also be taken without accounting for mealtimes. “K-Cap Tablet clearly demonstrates superiority and safety compared to existing drugs through the domestic market,” an official from HK Inno.N said. “, We hope to make it available in 100 countries by 2028 and become the world’s best gastric ulcer treatment.” At the awards ceremony, Koo noted that major changes, such as the strengthening of protectionist trade policies in major countries, will likely shake the global economy. “Technology developers are crucial in maintaining Korean companies’ position in the global market,” he said. The government will create an ecosystem where field researchers can freely experiment and achieve results without being burdened by the possibility of failure, Minister Lee said. “In the past, only large companies had research institutes for technology development, but now the culture of emphasizing technology development has spread to the extent that medium-sized and small companies also have technology development research institutes,” Chang said, adding that researchers are the “Korea’s cornerstone that can survive even in this era of technological competition.” 이 기사의 카테고리는 언론사의 분류를 따릅니다. 기사가 속한 카테고리는 언론사가 분류합니다. 언론사는 한 기사를 두 개 이상의 카테고리로 분류할 수 있습니다. 언론사는 한 기사를 두 개 이상의 카테고리로 분류할 수 있습니다.
